summary:
Certainly! Here is a comprehensive analysis of the ticket chain for ticket ID **2380335**, focusing on **relationships**, **linkages**, and **extracted details** from posts and notes.

---

## 1. **Parent-Child Relationships**

**Key Point:** The `linked_tickets` field is empty on all tickets in this chain, so there are **no explicit parent-child relationships** defined via system linkage. All tickets are only grouped in the chain via their shared `chain_hash`.

---

## 2. **Dispatch-Turnup-Billing Linkages**

### **Overview of Rational Linkages (By Subject, Timing, Content, Project, and Site)**

#### **A. Site Survey/Initial Scoping**
- **2380335**: Hardware-Wiring survey on 2/4/2025 (COMPLETE)
  - 28 cable runs noted (+1 possible for label printer)
  - Obstructions: None, Power outlet needed, ISP Circuit not located.
  - **Posts:** Survey completed, details outlined above.
  - Status: **Completed**

- **2382265**: Site Survey, also referencing site 8350/Hagerstown, completed 2/4.
  - **Note:** Links explicitly to ticket 2380335 via staff note.
  - Status: **Confirmed**

#### **B. Project Work: Cabling and Turnup**
- **2376701**: Hardware-Wiring, Network Upgrade (PROJECT MGMT)
  - Massive cable counts and drops in the scope (see below).
  - Status: **Closed**, part of 2/6/2025 “clean-up”.

- **2376830**: Turnup ticket, referencing remote resource for cutover job.
  - Related to network cutover after cabling.
  - Closed as "clean up" on 2/6/2025.

- **2380336**: Turnup Assist, planned for 2/12/2025, but closed as clean-up on 2/6/2025.

#### **C. Equipment/Materials**
- **2376735**: Shipping/Outbound ticket for all main project hardware.
  - Status: **Delivered** (by 2/12/2025).

#### **D. Actual Install Phases & Failed/Canceled Work**
- **2382333**: Hardware-Wiring P1, scheduled for 2/11/2025, **On Hold** (per Lucas).
- **2382726**: Hardware-Wiring P1 scheduled for 2/11/2025, **Failed** (canceled due to snow storm).
- **2382746**: P2 VPN Install, **Cancelled - CIS** (internal cancellation).
- **2389439**: P1 scheduled for 2/24/2025, **Cancelled - CIS** (not notified, pending reschedule).
- **2389461**: P2 scheduled for 2/25/2025, **Cancelled - CIS** (not notified, pending reschedule).
- **2384350 / 2385184**: Outlet Install(s), one scheduled, one **Failed** (needs reschedule).

#### **E. Billing/Completion**
- **2401881**: Billing for initial 50% (PO: 232498; $2808), moved to **On Hold** for FST Accounting.
- **2402063**: Billing for remaining 50% (PO: 232499; $2808), with detailed line-items in a note.
  - Note: Breakdown of billing lines and total ($3,268.00).

---

### **Implicit Workflows**
- **Survey → Cabling/Hardware Install (with shipment and outlet/PM tasks) → Turnup/Cutover → Billing**
- The tickets generally follow a logical progression, but work was **disrupted by weather, internal holds, or needing reschedules**.

---

## 3. **Orphaned or Unlinked Records**

- **All tickets are only logically grouped by shared project and chain_hash. None are system-linked via linked_tickets (all arrays are empty).**
- Some dispatch, survey, turnup, and billing tickets reference each other in **post content or staff notes** (e.g., "See ticket 2380335")—these are **soft references**, not database-level links.
- **Orphaned in database**: Yes; not explicitly linked. **Logically grouped**: Yes, by project/site/date/content/subject/notes.

---

## 4. **Extracted Specific Details from Posts, Notes, and Statuses**

### **A. Cable Drop Counts**

- **From ticket 2380335 posts (Survey on 2/4/2025):**
    - "28 cable runs needed."
    - "+1 additional cable run may be required for label printer."
    - "2 racks to be installed."

- **From project scoping (2376701/2380335/2380336 and others):**
    - WAP: Qty. 1 cable
    - DMB: Qty. 4 cables
    - Timer: Qty. 1 cable
    - Music: Qty. 1 cable
    - Manager Station: Qty. 4 cables
    - POS: Qty. 4 cables
    - POS w/ Jumper: Qty. 3 cables
    - Kiosk: Qty. 4 cables
    - Prep: Qty. 1 cable
    - Prep and Jumper: Qty. 2 cables
    - Timer (again): Qty. 1 cable
    - OCD and Outdoor DMB: Qty. 4 cables
    - (Details repeated in several scope/cutover tickets)

### **B. Completion Statuses**

- “**Completed**” – 2380335 (survey)
- “**Closed**” – 2376830, 2376701, 2380336 (due to clean up/abandonment or closure as part of project-wide wrap-up)
- "**Delivered**" – 2376735 (hardware shipment delivered)
- "**Confirmed**" – 2382265 (site survey)
- "**On Hold**" – 2382333 (hardware-wiring P1), 2401881, 2402063 (billing), per explicit staff notes ("On hold per Lucas")
- "**Failed**" – 2382726, 2385184 (install attempts cancelled due to snowstorm, incomplete/outlet install)
- "**Cancelled - CIS**" – 2382746, 2389439, 2389461 (internal cancelation, project paused, awaiting reschedule or client notification)
- "**Scheduled**" – 2384350 (outlet install, no resolution provided in posts)

### **C. Revisit Requirements/ Pending/ Delays**

- "Cancelled due to snow storm." (2382726)
- "Site is pending reschedule. The site has not been notified... new date will be communicated..." (2389439, 2389461)
- "Reschedule will be needed for tomorrow. Time to be determined later tonight." (2385184)
- "**On hold** per Lucas" (2382333)
- "This did not ship out, until Monday will be going out." (2376735, delay in hardware shipment)
- "Moving to audit/clean up..." (multiple project tickets)

### **D. Completion/Closure Notes**

- Multiple tickets were closed out as part of "clean up" or "audit", not through normal work progression.

### **E. Billing Details**

- **Split Billing**:
    - PO: 232498 – 50% upfront, $2808
    - PO: 232499 – Remaining 50%, $2808
    - **Breakdown in note**: Full cabling (3 night model): $2508, P3: $460, Survey: $75, Engineering/PM: $25, Remote turn up: $200; **Total $3,268**.

---

tickets.first_post_content:
Legacy Cabling Demo:

• CIS Technicians will properly demo all legacy data cabling in the building      AFTER they have completed the installation of the parallel network to      reduce downtime. This will be done carefully to avoid damaging other      trades.Network Buildout:

• Upon completion of the demolition of existing data cabling, technicians will      decommission existing networking equipment as required.
• If required, legacy networking devices will be left will local management or       dropped off at a local shipping provider to be sent back to a centralized       location.
• Rack installation:
• Install Qty. 1 – Open-frame Network Equipment Rack, wall-mounted with plywood        backboard in the Crew area.
• Rack to be mounted within 6” from the ceiling.
• Plywood will be securely fastened to the wall using structural wall supports         for the racks to mount to.

• Supply a coaxial demarc extension to the new rack location.

Legacy Cabling Demo:

• CIS Technicians will properly demo all legacy data cabling in the building AFTER they have completed the installation of the parallel network to reduce downtime. This will be done carefully to avoid damaging other trades.Network Buildout:

• Upon completion of the demolition of existing data cabling, technicians will decommission existing networking equipment as required.
• If required, legacy networking devices will be left will local management or dropped off at a local shipping provider to be sent back to a centralized location.

• Install Qty. 1 – Open-frame Network Equipment Rack, wall-mounted with plywood backboard in the Crew area.
• Rack to be mounted within 6” from the ceiling.

• Supply a coaxial demarc extension to the new rack location.

tickets.first_post_content:
Scope - Objective: Legacy Cabling Demo:

• CIS Technicians will properly demo all legacy data cabling in the building      AFTER they have completed the installation of the parallel network to      reduce downtime. This will be done carefully to avoid damaging other      trades.Network Buildout:

• Upon completion of the demolition of existing data cabling, technicians will      decommission existing networking equipment as required.
• If required, legacy networking devices will be left will local management or       dropped off at a local shipping provider to be sent back to a centralized       location.
• Rack installation:
• Install Qty. 1 – Open-frame Network Equipment Rack, wall-mounted with plywood        backboard in the Crew area.
• Rack to be mounted within 6” from the ceiling.
• Plywood will be securely fastened to the wall using structural wall supports         for the racks to mount to.
• Equipment Stack:
• Install Qty. 1 – 2U shelf for the Meraki switch and ISP modem to sit on inside        the rack.
• Supply a coaxial demarc extension to the new rack location.
• Install Qty. 2 – Network switches inside the racks for data connections.
• Install Qty. 1 – PDU in the data rack
• Install Qty. 1 – customer provided UPS inside the data rack.
• Install Qty. 2 – 2u shelf inside the security rack for the Actineon Nodes and        the Mood Media devices.
• Install Qty. 2 – Unloaded, Modular Patch Panel, 24-port inside the new racks for       data cabling.
• Unloaded patch panel will be populated with the correct, color-coded data jacks        in the alignment that the customer provided.
• Install Qty. 1 – Wireless Access Point in predetermined locations.
• All devices will be cross-connected following wiring diagrams/port mapping.
• All devices will be tested and turned up with the tech team.Horizontal (Cat 6) Cabling:

• From Rack 1 – Data Rack
• WAP
• Install Qty. 1 – Siemon Cat 6 Non-Plenum Cable(s) from the new data rack        location to an AP location(s) specified on the floorplan.
• If required, J-hook cable hangers will be added where legacy         infrastructure may have been lacking to ensure the new cabling meets         local and building codes.
• Terminate cabling to a male RJ45 Siemon Z-plug on the device end and to a black         Cat 6 data jack on the server end.
• All cabling will be tested and labeled on both ends of the cable to ensure         proper function.
• DMB
• Install Qty. 4 – Siemon Cat 6 Non-Plenum Cables from the new data rack location         to 4 separate single drop Digital Menu Bar location(s) specified on the         floorplan.
• If required, J-hook cable hangers will be added where legacy          infrastructure may have been lacking to ensure the new cabling meets          local and building codes.
• Terminate cabling to a Siemon yellow Cat 6 data jack housed in a modular          faceplate/patch panel on the device and server end.
• All cabling will be tested and labeled on both ends of the cable to ensure          proper function.
• Timer
• Install Qty. 1 – Siemon Cat 6 Non-Plenum Cables from the new data rack location         to Digital Menu Bar location(s) specified on the floorplan.
• If required, J-hook cable hangers will be added where legacy          infrastructure may have been lacking to ensure the new cabling meets          local and building codes.
• Terminate cabling to a Siemon black Cat 6 data jack housed in a modular          faceplate/patch panel on the device and server end.
• All cabling will be tested and labeled on both ends of the cable to ensure          proper function.
• Music
• Install Qty. 1 – Siemon Cat 6 Non-Plenum Cables from the new data rack location         to Digital Menu Bar location(s) specified on the floorplan.
• If required, J-hook cable hangers will be added where legacy          infrastructure may have been lacking to ensure the new cabling meets          local and building codes.
• Terminate cabling to a Siemon black Cat 6 data jack housed in a modular          faceplate/patch panel on the device and server end.
• All cabling will be tested and labeled on both ends of the cable to ensure          proper function.
• Manager Station
• Install Qty. 4 – Siemon Cat 6 Non-Plenum Cables from the new data rack location         to a quad drop Manager Station location(s) specified on the floorplan.
• If required, J-hook cable hangers will be added where legacy          infrastructure may have been lacking to ensure the new cabling meets          local and building codes.
• Terminate cabling to Siemon ivory, red, blue, and white Cat 6 data jack housed          in a modular faceplate/patch panel on the device and server end.
• All cabling will be tested and labeled on both ends of the cable to ensure          proper function.
• POS
• Install Qty. 4 – Siemon Cat 6 Non-Plenum Cables from the new data rack location         to 2 dual drop POS location(s) specified on the floorplan.
• If required, J-hook cable hangers will be added where legacy          infrastructure may have been lacking to ensure the new cabling meets          local and building codes.
• Terminate cabling to a Siemon green and violet Cat 6 data jack housed in a          modular faceplate/patch panel on the device and server end.
• All cabling will be tested and labeled on both ends of the cable to ensure          proper function.
• POS with Jumper
• Install Qty. 3 – Siemon Cat 6 Non-Plenum Cables from the new data rack location         to a triple drop POS with jumper location(s) specified on the         floorplan.
• If required, J-hook cable hangers will be added where legacy          infrastructure may have been lacking to ensure the new cabling meets          local and building codes.
• Terminate cabling to a Siemon green, violet, and blue Cat 6 data jack housed in          a modular faceplate/patch panel on the device and server end.
• All cabling will be tested and labeled on both ends of the cable to ensure          proper function.
• Kiosk
• Install Qty. 4 – Siemon Cat 6 Non-Plenum Cables from the new data rack location         to 2 dual drop kiosk location(s) specified on the floorplan.
• If required, J-hook cable hangers will be added where legacy          infrastructure may have been lacking to ensure the new cabling meets          local and building codes.
• Terminate cabling to a Siemon green and violet Cat 6 data jack housed in a          modular faceplate/patch panel on the device and server end.
• All cabling will be tested and labeled on both ends of the cable to ensure          proper function.
• Prep
• Install Qty. 1 – Siemon Cat 6 Non-Plenum Cables from the new data rack location         to a single drop prep location(s) specified on the floorplan.
• If required, J-hook cable hangers will be added where legacy          infrastructure may have been lacking to ensure the new cabling meets          local and building codes.
• Terminate cabling to a Siemon orange Cat 6 data jack housed in a modular          faceplate/patch panel on the device and server end.
• All cabling will be tested and labeled on both ends of the cable to ensure          proper function.
• Prep and Jumper
• Install Qty. 2 – Siemon Cat 6 Non-Plenum Cables from the new data rack location         to Digital Menu Bar location(s) specified on the floorplan.
• If required, J-hook cable hangers will be added where legacy          infrastructure may have been lacking to ensure the new cabling meets          local and building codes.
• Terminate cabling to a Siemon orange and blue Cat 6 data jack housed in a          modular faceplate/patch panel on the device and server end.
• All cabling will be tested and labeled on both ends of the cable to ensure          proper function.
• Timer
• Install Qty. 1 – Siemon Cat 6 Non-Plenum Cables from the new data rack location         to Digital Menu Bar location(s) specified on the floorplan.
• If required, J-hook cable hangers will be added where legacy          infrastructure may have been lacking to ensure the new cabling meets          local and building codes.
• Terminate cabling to a Siemon black Cat 6 data jack housed in a modular          faceplate/patch panel on the device and server end.
• All cabling will be tested and labeled on both ends of the cable to ensure          proper function.
• OCD and Outdoor DMB
• Install Qty. 4 – Siemon Cat 6 Non-Plenum Cables from the new data rack location         to Outdoor pedestals for a single drop OCD and quad drop Outdoor DMB         location(s) specified on the floorplan.
• If required, J-hook cable hangers will be added where legacy          infrastructure may have been lacking to ensure the new cabling meets          local and building codes.
• Terminate cabling to a Siemon male RJ-45 on the device end and to black and          yellow Cat 6 data jacks on the server end, black for OCD and yellow          for DMB.
• All cabling will be tested and labeled on both ends of the cable to ensure          proper function.
• From Rack 2 – Security Rack
• Cameras
• This scope of work assumes all cameras are installed and active, currently.
